title: Tracking Covid-19
description: Although Covid-19 is all over the news, I can't find any analysis that uses per-capita data on a log scale. For that reason, I've done this analysis myself.

title: Animating Covid-19
description: Previous analysis in this area has tended not to show maps over time against the right measures. I aim to do so here for Europe. The picture that emerges is one of sobering consistency.

title: Work in our friendly team!
description: There's a great job opening in our team and I wanted to tell you more.

title: PremPredict 2019/20
description: In this year's PremPredict, there are twenty teams, twenty-one players and a massive Â£105 up for grabs. In this post, I'll show the latest standings and our collective expectations for the season.

title: Is it all over?
description: I run 10,000 simulations on the final round of matches in the Premier League season, so as to project the odds of each player winning my PremPredict competition.

title: My R code snippets
description: I keep a list of frequently-used code snippets that I find valuable and, in the spirit of the R community, I thought it best to share them.

title: Holiday ideas
description:
Yes, it is a first world problem, but we always struggle with holiday destinations. I prefer flying upside down towards somewhere different, whilst my wife and boy aren't keen on heat or long flights. 
For that reason, I made this analysis to find somewhere that suits us all.

title: PremPredict R package
description: Given the repeated use of similar functions for posts about my PremPredict competition, I thought it made sense to build an R package for it. Here are some details about it.

title: Who you know?
description: I recently presented some of my work on building networks of investment managers. Here are some more details.

title: Asset manager evaluation
description:
Back in the day, I wrote research papers about investment practice. One example concerned how asset owners could better evaluate the investment performance of their asset managers. 
As I still like the idea, I thought that I'd share it with you, given that the materials are already in the public domain. Basically, the idea is to view performance in the way that a Bayesian would.

title: Brexit vote analysis
description:
I wanted a better understanding of the Brexit vote and so thought I'd analyse it. 
In this post, I therefore plot the Brexit vote and winning parliamentary party from 2016 by constituency, leaning heavily on the parlitools and ggiraph packages.

title: Who bats best?
description: Cricket commentators often bang on about changes in batting quality through the ages. Or they say that batting order matters to averages ... or vice-versa. But is there anything in these questions? In this post, I try and find out a bit.
